meanings.definition: The state of being annoyed, impatient, or angry.
meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions were major irritations during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Mosquito bites can be irritating irritations on a summer evening.
meanings.sent3: The way he mimicked her voice was more amusing than irritations.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing sound of the fly was like tiny irritations in his ears.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was an irritation that echoed through the house.

meanings.definition: Something that causes annoyance or anger.
meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door was one of the irritations of living in an apartment building.
meanings.sent2: Traffic jams are common irritations during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocking over the vase was an amusing irritation for the family.
meanings.sent4: The constant beeping of the alarm clock became an irritation in his daily routine.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on his shirt was a persistent irritation throughout the day.
